name: Tara Wigley
bio:
Author of HOW TO BUTTER TOAST: rhymes in a book that help you to cook. Published by Pavilion. Out now. 
Co-author of @ottolenghi SIMPLE and FALASTIN.

social_posts.post_text: Bake day for Christmas pressies. Woodland meringues from @ottolenghi and @helen_goh_bakes SWEET (p319) and Brunswick chocolate cookies from SIMPLE (p290). All set for gifting. Gluten free, if that of relevance. Mariah Carey and Christmas jumpers officially in da house! . . . #christmascookies

When it snowed last week I presumed that was the end of lido swimming for the season but kept seeing inspiring pictures of people still going for it. Decided to don my woolly hat and jump in too. Thanks for the inspiration @taniabrownyoga. And @vivgroskop. And @mscaitlinmoran who said that 4 degrees was somehow easier than 8 degrees and was sort of right. SO good! #brockwelllido

The problem is, I spend the whole year getting and reading all the books I want to get and read so that when my familam ask me what I want for Christmas, I see my list has already been achieved. Doh! Here is what it WOULD have looked like, though. SO much reading and cooking and cocktail making pleasure and spice inspiration and vicarious travels and wise words from the kitchen and beyond and lockdown libations and batch cooking tips and hassle-free feasts and chilles and stories and ways to boil water and goosebumps and butter and all good things. Christmas game to match the book with the description?! Thank you for your food-shaped books, @jeremyleequovadis @georginahayden @mark_diacono @alicelascelles @felicitycloake @tamar.e.adler @ixta.belfrage @samgatesfood @ahalfbakedidea @ellarisbridger @bonniestern (and the dreamy @bonnie_garmus_author with some of my other fave 2022 fiction writers) @therivercafelondon. Total gems, each and every one . . . What’s on your Christmas list?! #christmascookbooks
@chriswigley2106 thinks it’s gone too far. . .

The perfect rainy day holiday project for when the snow turns to downpour and you’re camping out (inside) all day. Chocolate and peanut butter s’mores. P48 of @ottolenghi and @helen_goh_bakes SWEET. Little guy’s choice . . .
Happy mozzarella snowmen, peeps x
Best birthday pressie ever. And birthday swim. And blowing away of 45 year old cobwebs. . .

Cinnamon pavlova, praline cream, fresh berries. Pulling out the stops (and @ottolenghi and @helen_goh_bakes SWEET) to distract from the fact that 4th January is a tough birthday to make fly! . . . Recipe on p291.
It’s my 14 year old son’s turn to cook Friday night supper. . . . @cheftimanderson what have you unleashed?! . . .
First (ever) jar of kimchi for 2023! The easy joy of setting an eminently achievable New Year’s resolution!
Topping up signed copies of @sami_tamimi and my beautiful #falastincookbook so that stocks are high ahead of its third birthday! Head to @ottolenghi_at_home if you’d like to buy.

It all looked so innocent, until. . . Devil’s Food Cake indeed, in @noorishbynoor and @ottolenghi’s #otkextragoodthings (and you can tell when @verenalochmuller is in the house when there is malted milk powder in the mascarpone cream!) Did somebody say WEEK-END! #devilsfoodcake

Who needs a filter when you have @natoora and @momokombucha’s Tomlinson’s Forced Rhubarb Kombucha. What a treat of a delivery! (Also, I thought my mid-week hot-pink package was TRULY personalised until I remembered that a ‘Tara’ is the weight of an empty container!) #forcedrhubarb #kombucha #cheers
Well, that’s ONE way to break New Year’s resolutions. . . #funkytown

Feeling sentimental about this day, three years ago, when @sami_tamimi and I were all dressed up and beaming for the FALASTIN publication party that - coinciding with London locking down - was not to be. Happy third anniversary #falastincookbook - thank goodness you’re a keeper!

Much fun had (and many slices of toast buttered) playing around with my talented buddy @emily.travis.photos to get a headshot for a new book I’m excited to soon reveal. High fives to anyone who can guess the title?! . . .
Feeling very culinarily at home . . . #kathmandu
Have za’atar, will travel . . . Planning on taking @zaytoun_cic goodies to hitherto unsprinkled places #everestbasecamp
Where’s Wally?  #everestbasecampteahouse
Meet Jack the Yak: he’s our team mascot . . . #everestbasecamp
#jacktheyak #everestbasecamp
@taniabrownyoga @shilpi_anahatayogaclapham @ivakt When’s the next retreat?!. . . #everestbasecamp
Fuel. #za’atar-on-tour #everestbasecamp
My dream trekking team . . . Scarlett and Theo and Casper and Chris and @jaggedglobe Jedin and Sudan and the right honourable Jack the Yak. . . #everestbasecamp #trekkingwithkids
The higher the altitude, the higher the (bartering) stakes . . . #everestbasecamp #dingboche4410metres
null
Happy Easter, peeps . . #travelessentials #everestbasecamp #easterat4410m
Spreading our mighty culinary traditions with the team. . . How DO you eat yours?! #everestbasecamp #highaltitudeeaster
Red nose, wrinkles, grey hair, happiness! . . . #blowingthecobwebsaway #everestbasecamp

My top trekking tip so far: water bottles by day, hot water bottles by night, once they’re filled up with freshly boiled water which then becomes wonderfully cool drinkable water the next day. So simple! So effective! (Putting stickers on our bottles of the food we were going to miss was not, day 12 of potatoes/rice/eggs, perhaps the best of ideas). #stayingwarmat4900m #keepthehimalyasclean #trekkingtips
When you start to look a little bit TOO much like your team mascot #jacktheyak

Scarlett and I, a near-empty jar of za’atar and Jack the Yak made it to #everestbasecamp today after an epic 11 day trek. We sprinkled the remains of the za’atar as our offering to Sagarmatha, hugged it out and headed back to find our boys who’d had to call it a day just a couple of hours before. Things I think I’ve learnt: it really IS about the journey, not the destination; you can get a LONG way just putting one foot in front of the other; never underestimate the positive impact of a fluffy team mascot (I had no idea!); kids rock; daughters are warriors; zip lock bags are really useful; altitude sickness is no joke; there IS such a thing as too many eggs and everything IS better with za’atar (if not feta!). I’m such a habitual person that there was part of me that was concerned how I’d cope/ who I’d be without my aubergines and podcasts, my lemons and my work, my cold water swims and feta, my time by myself and my comfy home bed. I’ve really surprised myself, to be honest, to learn that you can shake it all up and step away from all the things that you think make you you and see that there is still so much to learn, to change, to live. Thank you Himalayas. And now: a shower! #midlifereset #everestbasecamp
@noorishbynoor and @ottolenghi - the debate about whether or not to skin chickpeas continues on. . . #swayambunatha #monkeytemplekathmandu
Hard not to be tickled . . .#kathmandusightseeing

Time to go home. Jack the yak, Sagarmatha, Nepal, the MOUNTAINS, the momos, the time and space to breathe (apart from when breathing was hard): what a massive massive treat. And now: time to hit the road, Jack. . . #jacktheyak #familytrekking

I’m super excited to say that I’ve written a book - a collection of rhymes about food - called HOW TO BUTTER TOAST. The fewer ingredients there are in a dish, it seems to me, the more confusion there is about how to simply make it. How to roast a potato; how to boil an egg; how to make a martini; or even brew a cup of tea. There is so much conviction and certainty out there - about ‘the definitive’ way things should be done - that we can all end up pretty confused, right?! 

HOW TO BUTTER TOAST takes an irreverent look at all the different ways that things can be done before settling on the conclusion that if something looks good, seems good and tastes good then, well, this is just the way it should be! 

It’s a book to entertain, enlighten, reassure and ultimately liberate the culinarily confused and curious. It’s for everyone from 9 to 99: from kids and students making their first pesto and pancakes, through to food geeks obsessing about the perfect poached egg to everyone who just wants to relax in the knowledge that their roast chicken and potatoes are just GRAND. 

@ottolenghi has written a lovely foreword, @alecdohery has done the ridiculously brilliant illustrations, @pavilionbooks are the publishers extraordinaire and it will be available everywhere books are sold from September 14th. 

Available for pre-order now (for the student off to uni, for the organised get-Christmas-done crew, for the post-Summer fresh start, for anyone who’s curious about food, and rhymes, and fun things, for anyone and EVERYONE whose bookshelves are heaving with cookbooks who still feel none the wiser. . . ): links for where to do so are in my bio. 

Thank you for indulging my pre-publishing gush - cool concision from here on in - thank you THANK YOU for pre-ordering and thank you, of course, for telling me how you butter yours . . . 

.
.
.
#howtobuttertoast #foodrhymes #pavilionbooks #alecdoherty #howtocook

Not sure I’ve actually EVER said ‘cheese’ for the camera in a cheese factory! @verenalochmuller and @noorishbynoor and @katjatausig channeling their inner mouse at the wonderful @cheesemakers_of_canterbury yesterday during an #OTK team away day. Such fun scampering about @brogdale_collections orchard, @macknade and then ending up at the second-to-none @sportsmankent for an evening feast. #OTK #whitstable
Well, I bought the broad beans with the best quiche-shaped intentions but . . . couldn’t resist the @ottolenghi SIMPLE spring time classic: avocado and broad bean mash. #coronationfood

Coronation cauliflower. Made me miss my granny’s cooking. It’s brilliant, if you haven’t yet found it in @ottolenghi SIMPLE (p. 98). And Anna Hansen’s super duper chorizo scotch eggs in @themodernpantry cookbook. #leaningin #coronationfood

@fortnums goodie bag after the annual food and drink awards AND returning home to find the BRILLIANT @nikisegnit The Flavour Thesaurus: more flavours sitting on my doorstep. Happy publication day, Niki. Nightcap winner my end and what a treat in store for all of us to devour. Huge congrats to everyone who was shortlisted and won tonight - including @felicitycloake and @kitchenbee and @jaegawise and @stanleytucci and @jeremyleequovadis - all total superstars. A joy to raise glasses and inadvertently dress like the going home bag. . . #fortnumandmason #foodanddrinkawards

Hands up if @mark_diacono is one of your fave peeps in the industry?! I pinched him for a @fuckoffeebermondsey this morning (you can only get away with that name if your coffee is gooooooood) and we talked about work and Instagram and how we often forget to Instagram because we are so focussed on the work. So then we took a selfie and felt like champs. If you DON’T  know his work then put Instagram down immediately and rectify! . . . You have the biggest treat in store . . . #therealdeal

You know that you’ve been honeyed when you ask @honeyandco to do you a favour and give you their time to chat food and then get home to find out it’s THEM, not you, who’ve secretly snuck sweet surprise treats into the goodie bag . . . These GUYS! #honeyandco #bareboneschocolate #howtobuttertoast

They say you shouldn’t meet your heroes but . . . I MET WILF! (and the brilliant @felicitycloake who is, clearly, EVERYONE’s hero and even MORE so mine once it was quickly established that it felt far more normal and cute to take a selfie of our two bikes together - condor bikes unite! - rather than our smiling mugs! Managed one photo bomb, though . . .

Tell me how you make yours? What’s your secret? Postcard illustrations by the brilliant @alecdoherty; the book - How to butter toast - by me, published by @pavilionbooks on September 14th. Link to preorder in my bio. A set of postcards out to the response which makes me most want to think again. . . #howtobuttertoast

Having LOTS of zesting and grating fun with my bag of @microplaneintl goodies. Thanks so much for sending my way @fab_comm: you (and this new Black Sheep series) are saving me lots of time (and my knuckles!) this Saturday morning! #howtozestalemon #featherlightcheese #royalsocietyofprotrectiontoknuckles #blacksheepseries

HOW TO . . . HOST (a summer party and still enjoy yourself): get a batch or two of leek and za’atar rugelach in the freezer a week beforehand which you can then bake from frozen on the day. Recipe under wraps for the moment (you’ll have to kidnap @verenalochmuller and @helen_goh_bakes and @ottolenghi to find out) but hosting, hey, #allhailthefreezer #howtobuttertoast

HOW TO HOST a summer party (and still enjoy yourself) part II: pull some pork and get it in the freezer a week ahead. Link to the winningly easy @ottolenghi recipe in bio. #pulledpork #howtobuttertoast #pulledporksandwich #linkinbio

HOW TO . . . start the week knowing that you’ve got some instantly tasty meals within minutes to hand . . Make a jar of Chermoula, keep it in the fridge and then use it to: marinate fish before grilling; mix with butter and rub under a chicken’s skin before roasting; mix it with mayonnaise or yoghurt or cottage cheese as a side or dipping sauce for tofu/ chicken/ butter beans; add to any sort of fish cakes/ potato cakes if using up leftover mash; adding a little bit to an omelette and on and on. Or follow an actual recipe - link to @ottolenghi chermoula aubergine from Yotam and @sami_tamimi JERUSALEM. #batchcooking #howtobuttertoast #chermoula #simpleweeknightmeals

HOW TO . . . make shatta! Time lapse has allowed me to happily cut out the three days the chillies have to spend fermenting in the fridge, once sliced and salted, but it really IS as easy as slice, salt, wait, blitz, add some vinegar and lemon, jar, seal with oil and chilli AHOY. Hello eggs, hello fish, hello omelettes, hello hello HELLO! #letsshattatheworld #falastincookbook #chillisauce #howtobuttertoast #linktorecipeinbio

HOW TO. . . ROAST A POTATO. Is there a secret trick? Or is the trick that it’s all so easy? What are everyone’s tips and tricks? Listen in as I outline the conundrums, show the conviction (and therefore confusion) and then reassure that - whichever way you cut it - it’s ALL GOING TO BE OKAY. Oven on high, choose some fat, a nice big (shallow, thanks @rocketandsquash) tray, last thing to come out. Job done. Don’t overthink (as @helen_goh_bakes says). Play around with fat depending on the time of year (thanks, @ottolenghi), be very precise about how you measure your spuds (@nikisegnit) or precise-ish (check out @rocketandsquash for the visual) and know that - as with @missminifer - going to war with your mother over the oil vs butter debate IS a totally rationale state of affairs. @timhayward goes off to the pub, @georginahayden gives a pretty much perfect summary of the gospel according to @deliaonline . And the great, big roast potato-off between @felicitycloake and @marthadelacey . - well, that’s going to have to wait for the outtakes video, coming soon. . . . 

How do you roast yours? 

Next up: HOW TO . . . POACH AN EGG. Vinegar or no vinegar? Is the water set to a spin or sitting still? Are poaching pans acceptable?! Let the big debate commence, and see what . . . @rocketandsquash @felicitycloake @honeyandco @mark_diacono and @helen_goh_bakes all have to say. 

How to butter Toast published by @pavilionbooks in September @hqstories 

🎥 With big thanks to the brilliant jules @molten_films for filming (and help shape and so much more)  and @davidiancreative for top editing skills 

#perfectroastpotatoes 
#deliasmithroastpotatoes #howtobuttertoast

HOW TO. . . char an aubergine . .  Turn on flame, add an aubergine (or lots), leave there for about 15 minutes, use long tongs to turn so that all sides get charred. Transfer to colander (placed over sink or bowl), slit vertically so that juices drain, scoop out the flesh, transfer to food processor and then take it from there. Here I am batch making the aubergine cream from @ottolenghi and @ixta.belfrage FLAVOUR (x 3 the recipe, p. 38: lasts for days in the fridge) which has yoghurt, Dijon, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper but so many babaganoush/ M’tabbal options to play with . . . #batchcooking #charringaubergine #howtobuttertoast #spottheoutfitchange

HOW TO… peel a pomegranate. Slice in half horizontally, get a big bowl (ideally sat in a sink), hold one half - cut side down - in one hand and use the other hand to bash it with something a bit heavy like a wooden spoon. The seeds will fall out through your fingers, leaving just a few seeds to pick out with your hands. Done!

#peelingpomegranates #howtobuttertoast #kitchenhacks 

(thanks for video skills, Theo W)

HOW TO . . . feed a crowd with aubergine, making all the various elements the day before . . . Full recipe in @ottolenghi SIMPLE. Link to recipe in bio. #getaheadcooking #ottolenghiaubergine #cookingmadeeasy #howtobuttertoast

HOW TO. . . make some oranges into the most wonderfully punchy sauce for an all-time dinner winner @ottolenghi chicken salad. The magic of an entire orange (or five if you’re a pathological batch-maker like me) being simmered down for an hour, skins and all, with some honey and saffron and white wine vinegar. Here it’s used to coat chargrilled chicken (in a fennel and herb salad) but it’s a great addition to all sorts of sauces, salads, salsas and cakes. Link to recipe in bio #batchcooking #summersalads

HOW TO. . . poach an egg. Listen in as I reassure (it doesn’t need to look perfect to be a perfect poacher), enlighten (there really IS more than one way to poach an egg and they will all get you there) and entertain (either the sight of my egg going into the water or the vision of @rocketandsquash collecting his Cub Scout badge with poaching pan in hand).

How do you poach yours? 

With thanks to @rocketandsquash, @felicitycloake, @ottolenghi, @helen_goh_bakes, @honeyandco and @mark_diacono for top tips and tricks (and confirmation that everyone does things a slightly different way and that’s all okay). 

🎥 (and poached egg-shaped giggles) by @molten_films and editing by @davidiancreative 

All culinary confusions cleared up on September 14th, when HOW TO BUTTER TOAST is published by @pavilionbooks @hqstories 

Next up . . . HOW TO . . make a martini! So simple! SO confusing!

HOW TO. . . Make meringues! Egg whites, sugar, heat, whisk, cinnamon, shape, sprinkle, bake . . . Magically, brilliantly simple! 

(And the secret to meringues with a chewy middle = dark brown sugar as well as caster). Full recipe in the first @ottolenghi cookbook. Also online on lots of people’s blogs! 

#endofschoolyear gifts SORTED!

#makingmeringues #howtobuttertoast

HOW TO . . . batch-make @scully_chef ‘s hazelnut, spinach and tarragon pesto. . . This is playing a FULL time roll in my fridge at the moment: spooned on top of grilled cod for supper; stirred through quinoa for lunch, with feta; piled into a chicken sandwich for the familam; swirled through soup (it’s paired with Jerusalem artichoke soup in the @nopi_restaurant cookbook, p. 36. I’ve quadruped the recipe and freeze half. The remainder lasts for pretty much how long it takes me (and the odd family member) to get through. @scully_chef: see you Friday at @scullyrestaurant wohoooo. #recipeinbio #batchcooking #nopi #howtobuttertoast

The only person I was shameless enough to ask for a selfie with at the @harpercollinsuk summer author party . . . What a treat to be at @vamuseum after hours. . . 

Thanks for a great bash @harpercollinsuk and ace to see team @hqstories and @pavilionbooks. Good times with great peeps!

HOW TO. . . make a martini! How can a drink with SO few ingredients be the cause of so much conviction and confusion?! Vodka or gin? Dry or wet? (Or sloppy’ + giggles from She-Who-Knows-the-cocktail edits-QUEEN that is @alicelascelles). @honeyandco is having vodka, @scully_chef is having gin, @mark_diacono sounds like he’s had three already and @timhayward is absolutely DELIGHTED to be remembering the quote-of-all-martini-quotes. I could raise a glass with any or ALL of these cool peeps any night of the week. . . 

How do you like yours? 

Listen in to be reassured, enlightened and entertained. 

#howtobuttertoast #martini #sipsmith #tanqueray #cocchi #dukesbar

🎥 by (and one too many martinis with) @molten_films and editing by @davidiancreative

5 between 2 is okay, right?

#ginmartini 

Friday night FEASTING at @scullyrestaurant . . . Signature Tonka beans and tapioca pearls and arepa and smoked this and fermented that and pickled watermelon and charred whatnots and ridiculously good unasked for but very welcome desserts and ALL the good things . . .

HOW TO . . . Make food taste good. If you could have one motto in the kitchen, what would it be? Listen in for kitchen insights and top tips from @georginahayden, @honeyandco, @timhayward, @felicitycloake, @missminifer, @nikisegnit, @angelacooking, @ottolenghi and @rocketandsquash. Whose camp are you most in? 

And apologies for auto text typo @rocketandsquash: I left it in as it just cracked me up. You’re so right. Timmy (which is what I’m going to call my back cover guy from here on in) DOESN’T have all the answers . . . 

#kitchentips #howtobuttertoast 

📹 and editing very much NOT by @molten_films and @davidiancreative this time: their different-league insta vids drop every Thursday!

HOW (not) TO . . . record an audio book. . .. Outtakes from an epic day recording with the eminently more skilled than me (and highly patient!) Rebecca and Guadalupe at @harperaudio and Santi at @rearwindowstudios. DELIGHTED to report that it’s a wrap and all bloopers are now on the studio floor. A tiny insight, on my part, as to how much work goes into making the books that finally get to market so slick and polished. There are such amazing teams working together behind every single edition of every single book! 

And for a bonus ‘How to’, listen to the end, courtesy of Spanish Santi! I’m really excited about the audio edition of HOW TO BUTTER TOAST: it’ll be a great one to listen to whilst pottering around the kitchen and also really family friendly and conversation generating for long car journeys. Links to pre-order the audio edition in bio. 

#audiobook #howtobuttertoast #outtakes #bloopers

HOW TO . . .make hummus. . . Listen in for some BiG reveals. . . @ottolenghi everyone will love you even MORE for the honesty of your ‘confession’! @felicitycloake you are in tahini rehab so this is a safe space, judgment-free zone. Do not cancel @felicitycloake! Itamar we know you are just happily pinching it from your @honeyandco supplies - we should all be so lucky! -  and @timhayward, @georginahayden and @rocketandsquash are all just sounding superbly relaxed about the matter. As they well should be as this is such an easy one to make. Keep it simple. Stick to four ingredients. Use creamy, nutty Arabic tahini (@belazu_co also do a great one) and NEVER add olive oil to the mix when it’s being blitzed up! That’s to drizzle on top. @zaytoun_cic olive oil if you want the creme de-la-Palestinian-olive-oil-CREME! And is anyone else, like me, adding a cube of ice to the machine when it’s whizzing around?! High-fives to fans of the @noorishbynoor recipe for hummus with lovely toppings in @sami_tamimi and my #falastincookbook 

Full insights in How to Butter Toast, published by @pavilionbooks on 14th September. 

How do you make yours? 

#homemadehummus #howtobuttertoast #easierthanyouthink 

🎥 by @molten_films (whose going home bag had a lot of tahini in it) and editing by @davidiancreative

You know you chose the right book cover when you don’t feel the need to apply a filter. . . Look how this puppy POPS! 

Two months today until publication. September birthdays SORTED (once you pre-order!). . . 

#howtobuttertoast #bookdesign #alecdoherty #pavilionbooks

HOW TO . . . make pastry. . . Truth be told I am naturally RUBBISH at making pastry - all that flour all over everywhere! - but I pulled up my big-girl socks ahead of the @ottolenghi publication of @katjatausig peach and chilli galette with pistachio frangipani (recipe published in august). Making pastry really IS just a case of mixing flour and cold butter and liquid (in this case buttermilk and in this case also some ground almonds and sweet vinegar). . Chill it, roll it, fold it, rest it, bake it, cool it, slice it, eat it! Keep things cool, including your head, and it’s all good! So empowering for those who think pastry is something they just ‘can’t’ do. . . Basically edible play-doh!

Keep an eye out for the recipe in august (which has the addition of sliced chillies in the syrup and ground cardamom in the pastry which I left out as kids don’t like the one and I didn’t have the other)! 

#howtomakepastry #frangipani #howtobuttertoast #cookingmadeeasy

HOW TO. . . make a cup of tea . . . Milk in first or water in first? Sugar or no sugar? China cup or mug? Loose leaf or bag!? What do your choices say about you? Listen in as @missminifer, @georginahayden, @mark_diacono, @felicitycloake, @timhayward, @ottolenghi and @helen_goh_bakes share their teatime tips and tricks, their convictions and confessions. Guess who’s china cup and who is mug? Loose leaf or bag? Steep or stew? And clearly no slurpers. . . right?!

How do you make yours? 

#teatime #howtobuttertoast 

🎥 @molten_films, editing by @davidiancreative

HOW TO. . . Make someone’s day! Find out they’re just home from holiday and missing watermelon, delight in the fact that you’ve just partnered with @natoora to create an amazing new watermelon kombucha and then casually mention you’re driving by and have some in the van! Thank you so much Ella and team @momokombucha : you guys rock. Laundry paused whilst holiday moment is re-created! 

#doorstopdelivery #dailyactsofkindness #watermelon #kombucha

HOW TO. . . make a tomato sauce. Is it really SO simple or is there some secret ingredient? Canned or fresh tomatoes? Olive oil or butter? Onion or garlic? Choices, choices or anything (and everything) goes?! Listen in to find out how @georginahayden, @honeyandco, @mark_diacono, @felicitycloake, @missminifer and @rocketandsquash make theirs. 

And to read more on this and all other vital life questions, pre-order HOW TO BUTTER TOAST, published 14th September by @pavilionbooks 

#tomatosauce #howtobuttertoast #marcellahazan 

🎥 @molten_films and editing by @davidiancreative and rockstar tomato sauce illustration, as always, by @alecdoherty

HOW TO . . . massively jazz up a kilo of beef tomatoes . . . Gently fry some aromatics (chilli, garlic, ginger, coriander stalks), brush the infused oil over thick slices of said tomatoes, grill them for about 10 minutes and then sprinkle over the aromatics along with some fresh coriander and toasted black mustard seeds. I served these with the steamed aubergine and miso chicken from @ottolenghi SIMPLE but you can just as well serve as they are with crusty white bread. Full recipe in #ottolenghisimple and link also in bio. 

#grilledtomatoes #simplecooking #howtobuttertoast

HOW TO. . . cook a steak. So many people go through their whole life not cooking a steak at home but why do we make it so complicated? What cut should we go for, how many times to flip it in the pan, when to season and what to serve it with? Listen in as @felicitycloake, @rocketandsquash, @honeyandco, @georginahayden and @timhayward (who was eating a steak pie for breakfast when I went to chat with him and most definitely knows his steak stuff) tell us what they like and what they do and what they SAY they like (even if they secretly prefer something else!). Steak! Does it really need to be as complicated as we can make out?! 

Steak (and other culinary) confusions ALL sorted and ironed out, once and for all, in HOW TO BUTTER TOAST, published by @pavilionbooks in September and available for pre-order now. Links in bio. 

#steak #steakdinner #howtobuttertoast 

🎥 @molten_films and editing @davidiancreative

When not being able to make a September launch (have I mentioned that I have a book coming out soon?!) turns into a treat of a lunch . . . 

Does everyone know @zahterlondon and the warrior-genius that is @esramuslu? Carnaby street, London. Can recommend sitting by newly-opened massive windows looking into the cobbled street whilst feasting on all the good things. 

And everyone knows @foodgillysmith, yes? Another warrior-genius-beaut who I’m lucky enough to know and get to chew the cud with. On-line, off-line and - available to all who care about food and stories and the stories we tell through food - on her brilliant weekly Cooking The Books podcast. I always get a little ‘whoop’ when a new episode drops into my feed. Next week it will be a whoop AND an eek as Gilly and I throw motherhood - and the process that is matresence- into the mix as part of Gilly’s Cooking the Books summer mini-series. And if you don’t know what #matresence is then welcome to the conversation. Listen in, open up, share the stories! Let’s get the word out there! 

So, @zahterlondon, @esramuslu, @foodgillysmith and #matresence. Positively homework-inducing post! Go for all of the above and your table will be SET!

HOW TO. . . boil an egg. . . This was the original title for my soon-to-be-published book before I accepted that the title really HAD been taken by a certain Mrs @deliaonline Smith. A boiled egg is always the thing that makes me question myself. However many I’ve boiled, I’m always slightly surprised/relieved/IMPRESSED when they come out just right (hard white, squidgy yellow). Listen in for top (albeit contradictory!) tricks and tips from @georginahayden, @helen_goh_bakes, @scully_chef, @nikisegnit and @timhayward. 

How do YOU boil yours? 

#boiledeggs #howtobuttertoast 

🎥 @molten_films (relieved it was not a poacher this time), editing @davidiancreative

One month tomorrow until publication. Shoe situation SORTED . . .

(And now just need to luck out on finding a yellow that I can wear - anywhere other than on my feet - without looking ridiculous). . . 

(Swipe for previous attempts to dress like one’s book cover!). . . 

#howtobuttertoast #airjordanretro

HOW TO. . . dress like one’s book cover without looking like a minion. . . 

Only one month to go until publication! 

Have you pretty-please pre-ordered? 

(And, yes, this is what happens when teenagers take control of the insta post. Game duly UP-ed)!. . . 

#howtobuttertoast

HOW TO. . . be a mother. . . Slightly different recipe this week in the form of my interview with the brilliant @foodgillysmith in her Cooking the Books podcast. We chat all-things-TOAST but we also deep-dive into matresence, as part of Gilly’s summer series. Matresence is the process of mothering. There is no such thing as ‘how to be a mother’ as we are all constantly learning and changing and getting it right and wrong and up and down. 

Listen in as we chat pancakes and jam and how to peel a banana. We high-five the women we’re on this journey with and mention those who keep us company and keep us sane through their words. This one is for every woman who cares and cooks and cooks to care. We would so love to hear your thoughts and get this conversation GOING. 

For my part, for todays conversation, I’m high-fiving the following warrior women who have inspired me to go for it with my work and to believe. . 

High fives to @darina_allen and all-things ballymaloe @ballymaloecookeryschool - trust in the process! - the writings of @nigellalawson and @kitchenbee and @felicitycloake and @finneyclare and Nora Ephron and MFK Fisher and Laurie Colwin. To @thejessiebuckley and her Wild Rose ‘mince’ and @sophichka_art whose mince will always be Theo’s mince and @fundaceylanlondon whose baked bean and chicken pie remains the stuff of LEGEND. High fives to @teenagersuntangled  as whose ‘full time availability’ line I’ve nicked and whose podcast is full of wise words and top tips for all mothers. And if none of that means ANYTHING then you’ll all just have to listen in to find out more . . . 

(HOW TO. . . Be a mother. I think it’s absolutely KEY to pull faces in ALL photos. Beyond that, ask me when I’m 90. ). . 

#matresence #matresencesupport #howtobuttertoast

Kiddie-made-bespoke-HOW TO BUTTER TOAST-merch*, one painted stone paperweight at a time. 

#deskdelights #howtobuttertoast 

* not ACTUALLY selling these . . .

HOW TO. . . roast a chicken! The ULTIMATE debate! Olive oil or butter? To spatchcock or not? High heat, low heat, turn it upside down?! @felicitycloake poaches, @helen_goh_bakes can go either olive oil or butter way, @scully_chef butterflies and, well, you’ll just have to listen in to see what @timhayward does with his chicken! 

How do you roast yours?! 

#roastchicken #roastchickendinner #roastchickenrecipe #howtobuttertoast 

🎥 @molten_films, editing @davidiancreative, chicken from @moenandsons

HOW TO make someone’s September a bit smoother . . . 

Buy them a copy of #howtobutter toast, take them to @gailsbakery for a slice of their finest and slip a pack of @yeovalley butter into their (cool)bag on the way home. It was always a goodie package just WAITING to happen!. . . 

Out on 14th September, published by @pavilionbooks 

#feelslikechristmasevewheniwasakid

Shout out to all the independents I visited today, to wave the How to Butter Toast flag. I was a bit nervous, to be honest, turning up out of the blue, but could not have felt more welcome and encouraged and less random! It made me feel so happy to know how many amazing bookshops and booksellers and cool peeps are out there, selling the words and stories and pictures and tales that so many are compelled to tell. London you were swelteringly wonderful today! Thanks so much for the good vibes, @claphambooks and @nomad_books and @moenandsons (I know they’re not a bookshop but Gary is THE MAN who makes the thought of selling books in the window of a butchers seem TOTALLY reasonable) and @davidmelloruk (again, not an indie bookshop but my dreamy-favourite shop in London and they always make such a thing of great books and they have such STYLE) and see you tomorrow @backstory.london and @chenerbooks and @villagebooksdulwich for my onward bike shop book shop tour! One week to go if you want to buy online from indie bookshops then check out the brilliant @bookshop_org_uk ! #howtobuttertoast #independentbookstore #bookshop

Practising @noorishbynoor’s peas with tahini and za’atar ahead of @thechayamaya and my 2pm demo on The Outer Bailey Demo Stage at the brilliant @ludlowfood festival tomorrow! Ingredients: peas, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, lots of herbs and za’atar and sliced radish and spring onion and SUNCREAM. (Not really). We will miss you @noorishbynoor but promise to do justice to your peas and your baked feta and maple walnuts and tahini-Parmesan dressing and crushed carrots and coriander and pistachio pesto and all good things! Takin’ the show on the road! . . . (And then I’m hot FOOTING it to the Castle Garden Stage to change hats and chat HOW TO BUTTER TOAST at 3pm). . . (And then I’m hot FOOTING it to whoever will sell me a really massive and very cold glass of something to see out the week). #ludlowfoodfestival

One day, two events, one epic @thechayamaya, four amazing dishes demoed from SHELF LOVE and EXTRA GOOD THINGS. One new favourite place ever (@dinhamweirhouse), two weir swims, one talk about HOW TO BUTTER TOAST (turns out that poaching eggs is THE controversial one), one massive glass of wine with the dreamy @kittycoles, one NINE course supper from the brilliant @slowfoodludlow and one very cool duck. 

@ludlowfood you’re brilliant thank you for having us (and thank you @honeyandco for waving your magic wand!) and thank you Jude and Liz at @dinhamweirhouse for the haven. You guys spoilt us!

Pre-pub INDUSTRY. . . . prepping take home goodies thanks to @moo who have made me the most BRILLIANT postcards and bookmarks and menu cards and all-sorts-of-things cards. These guys (my peeps AND team MOO) are the best. Bespoke stationary = life goal TICKED!! @bertinetbakery bread and @yeovalley butter going in fresh! #moo #howtobuttertoast

HOW TO . . . fry an aubergine . . . Dice, salt, wait, pat dry, fry. . . 

Possibly not recommended on the hottest day of the year . . 

#friedaubergine #howtobuttertoast

Why does it tickle me SO very much to dress up like my book cover?! 

#howtobuttertoast

Behind every book launch there’s a YES-people crew. Thank you so much to Josh and Lisa and Ella at @momokombucha for the kombucha margaritas and to Amy and Jamie from @sipsmith for ALL the martinis; to Jean at @story_public_relations and @alicelascelles for making the gin happen. To @tomatotamara for food EXTRAORDINAIRE you are the best - anyone who needs recipes testing or making Tamara is for you!; to Itamar and Sarit and Louisa at @honeyandco for letting us make @honeyandsmokerestaurant our party place; to Kirat and all at @phloxbooks for selling (and finding!) my books you’re brilliant and to @yeovalley and @bertinetbakery for the goodie bag bread and butter. To Helen and Corin and all at @moo for the coolest fliers and menu cards and postcards and book marks a girl who loves stationary could  EVER dream of. And to @editorial_ellen and @lcs_editor and @sophie.c.allen and Alice and Steph and Becci and Kim and Lisa and all of team @hqstories and @pavilionbooks for waving all of your magic wands. This party has only just begun, right?! 

How to butter toast is out this Thursday, wherever books are sold.

Events are back! 
Tara Wigley will be joining us in the shop next Thursday for food chat galore - a mini cook off, a bit of sauce judging and a martini or two! 
Grab a ticket while we have them - in the shop or online now 👩‍🍳

HOW TO. . . butter toast. . . Mic drop on this most important of all matters from @felicitycloake, @ottolenghi, @rocketandsquash, @georginahayden, @nikisegnit, @honeyandco and the final word goes to he-who-knows-as-he-owns-a-bakery Tim Hayward. 

Do we even TRUST those who own a toast rack? Are butter knives okay? How many times should we butter our toast?!. 

How do you butter yours? 

Also, have I mentioned?. . . 

How to butter toast is out now, sold wherever books are. 

#howtobuttertoast #toastrack #butter 

🎬@molten_films, editing @davidiancreative

Making a little batch of three different pestos to take in for @alexisconran_official and team to try tomorrow on @timesradio at 3pm. Listen in! I’ve got a tarragon, spinach and hazelnut pesto; a coriander, spring onion and pistachio pesto and a basil, pine nut and Parmesan pesto. I’m excited to do a blind test, for fun, and to spread the JOY of how quick and easy and versatile pesto - which means ‘crush’ or ‘pound’ - is to make and use. It’s literally a herb + a nut + good olive oil + garlic and salt and pepper and then  play. . . #timesradio #pesto #howtobuttertoast

We had so much fun last week serving Watermelon Kombucha Margaritas at the launch of Tara Wigley’s new book - How to Butter Toast: rhymes in a book, that help you cook.

The cocktails were made using the incredible El Rayo Tequila, definitely the best we’ve tasted.

If you are a budding chef, weekend cook or looking for a gift for a foodie friend we can’t recommend this book enough.

Thanks for having us Tara x

LOVING quite how much @phloxbooks and I are planning to fit into just one evening this Thursday. Cocktail (note KEY use of singular, martini heads) and canapés (plural), chats and rhyme readings, AND a little live-audience-demo situation where we are going to pitch two tea makers and two boiled egg makers side by side to compare and contrast their ‘HOW TO’s!’. AND (not that cooking should ever be a competition), we are having, well, a competition for anyone who wants to bring in their own READY-MADE (!) home-made tomato sauce so that we can have a taste and see whose is the best (and to learn what their secret ingredient is, if they’ll tell us!). 

It’s going to be marvellous mayhem but it’s also going to be VERY okay as our last secret ingredient and magic trick for the night is having @rocketandsquash in the house who will be bringing a little bit or order (and all the top chat) to the table. He also knows a LOT about eggs (other ingredients too) so he’s in charge of boiled egg judgement. 

Whose coming? 

#phloxbooks #independentbookshop #boiledeggs #cupoftea #tomatosauce #howtobuttertoast
 
(Photo taken at @scullyrestaurant where use of plural, martini wise, MIGHT have been reached for). . .

Not sure if I love my new @nethertonfoundry spun iron pan or @katjatausig’s feta and dill frittata more? The combination is making me very happy indeed. Getting set for nibbles at @phloxbooks event tonight. And yes that IS a whole block of feta in the middle of a frittata. . 

Thanks @ludlowfood for top shop op! Recipe for @katjatausig frittata in recent feta column in the @guardianfeast 

#Everythingsbettawithfeta

HOW TO BUTTER TOAST: rhymes in a(n audio) book, that help you to cook. Have you thought about downloading the AUDIO EDITION of How to Butter Toast? It’s fab to listen in to as you potter around the kitchen or to listen to in the car with kids. It makes all sorts of recipes super accessible to kids of all ages and is the springboard for MUCH car journey debate, I find . . . 

Rhyme omissions according to my kids: how to make a grilled cheese sandwich, how to make a mashed banana sandwich and how to fit as many different cereals in one bowl (not a sandwich). What else have I left out?!

#audiobook #howtobuttertoast #rhymes

One bookshop, two induction hobs, one kettle, two boiled eggs, one tomato sauce competition, a few too many snacks, one Thursday night cocktail, a tonne of great vibes, much egg-related disagreement, two read-aloud rhymes, one lovely chat and q@a and the biblical rain even STOPPED. Team @phloxbooks you guys are the best - I wish there was a clone of you in every community - and @rocketandsquash thanks so much for holding the evening together and showing us the perfect, fudgy, jammy, dippy egg. And anyone else’s mouth still tingling from the secret ingredient in ‘that’ tomato sauce?! 

#howtobuttertoast #independentbookshop #phloxbooks

I LOVE what @davidmelloruk do with books at the best of times - colour matching their displays, giving books lots of space and pride of place on their tables - and I PARTICULARLY love it when I pop by and they’ve done it with mine! (and @ottolenghi and @jeremyleeqv). It’s such a dangerously beautiful shop, full of everything I basically dream of!
Where’s Wally?

Name that space?! 

(Clue: it’s where every book ever written dreams of being stocked and signed and sold!). . .

HOW TO. . . tell how old your egg is. One for some teatime egg floating experiments with the kids?. For more on all the ‘How to’s’ when it comes to eggs - how to scramble, how to fry, how to poach or make into an omelette - I’ve got you! 

#howtobuttertoast #eggs

HOW TO MAKE . . . hazelnut praline . . . I always find the process of making praline a little bit magic. It just feels too simple to be this good! Toasted nuts (200g)  stirred into melted, caramelised sugar (180g) with a pinch of salt and then spread out on parchment paper to cool down and firm up. Then blitz blitz blitz for 5 minutes and it turns into creamy, nutty, smooth praline. It’s inside this cake and on tomorrows waffles, with sliced banana and squirty cream. Link to slightly more grown up recipe (for the Devil’s food cake) in bio . . .

So happy to know that @london_cm exists, as a community, and SO delighted to have been asked to speak at their last gathering. The theme was ‘simplicity’ - how to find clarity amidst the chaos - so it was right up my HOW TO BUTTER TOAST street. The moral of the morning seemed to be to ‘trust the process’, ‘pretend that things are simpler than they are’ and ‘don’t wait for the stars to align before taking action’. As true for life as for the kitchen? I’m so impressed that so many people woke up and showed up on a Friday morning before work to chat, listen and exchange ideas. Oh, and eat the FEAST the team made. And, yes, that IS rock, paper, scissors being played and, yes, everyone really WAS having a ridiculously jolly time at 8.30 in the morning. Thanks so much to the CM team - Mayssa, Al, Kristen, Bernardo - and to Kirat at @phloxbooks for selling books (what goes on tour, stays on tour!) and to the @london_cm community who engaged, played and joined me so happily into a deep dive on hummus.

📷@anutawang

When I launched my book last month, the sensationally sippable @sipsmith was in the @honeyandsmokerestaurant house. From the arrival of their copper trike - swan head emerging; martini cocktail promising - to the last (very chilled) glass, it all felt very much NOT like a Monday night. I love Sipsmith gin - frankly, they had me at ‘lemon zest’ - but I also love the story of the company: how it came to be and what it did to kickstart the whole London Dry Gin-aissance in the early 2000s. Did you know about the old British tax law which the three founders of Sipsmith overturned in order to be able to make gin in batches of less than 1,800 litres? Well, whether you want to deep-dive into excise acts which were in effect from 1823 or you just want to cut to the G&T or martini chase, can I recommend you give Sipsmith a go, next time you are scanning the bar tender’s shelves. . . Thanks Sipsmith. I’m not sure a party will ever be a party, from. here on in, without Jamie and Amy and a massive, copper, swan-bedecked, martini-serving trike in tow. 

Thanks also to Jean and co @thestoryagency for all your help and @alicelascelles for the first intro (and all martini top tips)

This weeks guest is the lovely Tara Wigley. 

Tara spent a decade working in publishing–before going to cookery school in Ireland. Where she spent 3 months with her twin toddlers and her dog. She has developed, tested, and writen recipes for Ottolenghi’s weekly column in the Guardian magazine and monthly New York Times’s columns, as well as for his cookbooks. 
She is the co-author of the award-winning Falastin, - in-house writer of Team Ottolenghi, Yotam’s co-author on eight of the biggest food books, including the million-seller, Ottolenghi Simple.. and mother of teen twins and a tween.
Her hilarious and often biting ditties on Instagram have won her a new audience which is interested more in her own voice; How to Butter Toast is a recipe book without recipes, a rhyming route through the how-tos of cooking which is both reassuring and entertaining. 

Listen wherever you get your podcasts and let us know what you think! 

Thank you very much to @discovergreatveg for sponsoring this weeks episode of Desert Island Dishes 💛

#quickfire #desertislanddishes #food

If aubergines are my desert island ingredient, then @toast is absolutely my desert island wardrobe. I’ve been a @toast clone for as long as I’ve been buying clothes so I was deeeee-lighted to collaborate, chat, char and all good things. And my desert island peeps? That’ll be my gorgeous daughter Scarlett, my super cool mum Suzanna and the MILKING IT FOR THE SHOOT Molly the dog. 

Stunning 📷from the properly divine @dearsafia 
Words from the super lovely @georgiagmurray 
Clothes from @toast 
Link to @toast magazine in my bio 
#dreamgig

HOW TO . . . make the perfect chocolate cake. @helen_goh_bakes take-home chocolate cake, aka ‘the world’s best chocolate cake’. Recipe in @ottolenghi SWEET. Easy peasy (chocolate) pudding and pie . . . 

#chocolatecake #birthdaycake #howtobuttertoast

So happy to have been sent this picture from @aldeburghbookshop one of my absolutes favourite indie bookshops. Wish I was by the Suffolk seaside too! And the happiest of blue sandwiches; super chuffed to be hanging out on the shelves in between @kitchenbee and @sabrinaghayour 

#independentbookshop #aldeburgh #howtobuttertoast

Join me and all those “Run(ning) the Wall” in support of innocent civilians. It’s a 5km run, wherever you are, anytime between the 3rd and 5th November. 

For more information, and for ways to fundraise and donate, please follow @amos_trust and/or see link in my bio to donate. 

#amosdoeshope

TOAST ON (a West Country) TOUR!! I’m so looking forward to scampering off to book-loving and very beautiful Bruton and Shaftesbury in three weeks time. Come join the fun? 

Wednesday 29th Nov: 

11-3 at the @stripyduckbookshopcafe signing books and hanging out and chatting and chilling and generally questioning my life choices as to why I don’t live in Bruton and own a cafe called Stripy Duck Bookshop Cafe. 

7pm at the dreamy @atthechapel, chatting with the brilliant @carosomerset about all things #howtobuttertoast 

Thursday 30th November 

6.30pm at @thekitchentabledorset for a glass of wine and some nice (and well travelled) nibbles and chats and a little in-house, relaxed competition to sort out this poached egg lark once and for all. 

Thursday 7th December 

Can’t keep me away so I’m back again to @toppingsbath for a 7.30 event where we are going to chat and boil eggs! 

Let me know if I’ll see you there?!

Full disclosure: I think women and mothers are all INCREDIBLE and that family mealtimes (can be) a minefield! Food might be (some of) our love language but what if our kids just want to live on jacket potatoes? Do we all need to be eating the same meal to be the sort of family we want to be, or thought we would be? Why do my kids thank me MOST when it’s pizza night and I’ve clocked off and it’s TV supper? Why the dark nights of the soul about whether or not the kids will think fondly of ‘mums’ delicious this or that. Does it all matter, so long as everyone is healthy and happy and the kitchen table is a nice place to be. I can’t wait to chat openly and frankly about these questions and so much more with these QUEENS - @thomasinamiers and @emilyscottfood and @amy__poon and @skyemcalpine - as part of the publication celebrations around @finneyclare’s stunning, honest, confronting, kind and clever memoir Hungry Heart. Come and join us! 13th November, 7pm @carousel_ldn. Mealtimes and Mothers. Links to tickets in my bio. 

(All part of the #matresence journey, right @foodgillysmith?! (with whom I chatted about so much of this as part of her mini-series on Matresence - the process of becoming a mother - on Gilly’s Cooking the Books podcast). 

And big thank you @dearsafia for my author photo.

location.city_name: The Rose & Crown Public House, Clapham Old Town

social_posts.post_text:
SPECIAL EVENT | Join us for a festive evening with @tara.wigley How to Host Christmas Dinner 🎄✨

Indulge in a delightful 3-course feast featuring your choice of a meat or vegetarian set menu, served family-style. Plus, all guests will receive a signed copy of Tara Wigley's latest book, 'How to Butter Toast,' for added culinary inspiration! Don't miss this opportunity to learn the art of hosting Christmas dinner from a pro. 

Tara will also be gifting recipe cards to elevate your festive celebrations. Book your seat now and get ready to make this holiday season unforgettable! 

📅 Date: Wednesday, December 13, 2023
⏰ Time: 5:30 PM
💰 Ticket Price: £60 per ticket

🔗Link to BOOK in our BIO 👆
#clapham #events #christmas

EVENT ✨🍴 // @tara.wigley is the in house writer at Ottolenghi, a long-time Clapham local and has just bought out her debut book “How to Butter Toast” a charming rhyming-recipe tone full of simplified, delicious recipes that’s all about liberating the home cook.

She’s going to be hosting a supper at @roseandcrownclapham on 13th December; “How to host Christmas dinner” will not just be a delicious 3 course festive meal with a twist, but you’ll also walk away with all the tips and tricks of how to do reproduce your own fantastic festive menu. In classic Tara style, there will be loads of family style food to be shared. Juicy chicken thighs with a walnut and pomegranate salsa. Charred, slow cooked sprouts. 

Honey roasted carrots. Baked rice with confit tomatoes… the kind of food that you REALLY want to eat. And, again in Tara style, all these dishes are perfect for making ahead, so if you decide you want them on your table this festive period, you’ll get to enjoy the meal as much as your guests will.

Tickets are on sale now. Get ‘em whilst you can, these will sell out!

📆: 13th December

📍: 2 The Polygon, London SW4 0JG
#BestOfClapham #clapham #events

HOW TO. . . Host Christmas! 

Come and be my guests at the @roseandcrownclapham pub on the 13th December for a Christmas lunch test run! I cook, you eat and be merry! 

Come with some buddies, eat my festive feast and then have me on hand to chat through all of your culinary Christmas questions! . . . How to scale up a dish? What can be made in advance? What can be subbed for what? How not to turn into your mother-in-law? 

Christmas! We’ve got this covered! Three courses, £45, Christmas spirit, take home Christmas how-to tips AND cookies . . 

Link in bio to book (don’t get confused by different time options from RESY to sit down: it’s a 5.30 start for all) . . 

. #howtohostchristmas #christmascooking #roseandcrownpub #bestofclapham #howtobuttertoast

Why do I always forget that, at this time of the year, I feel completely jittery? So much to do and not knowing what to prioritise and not feeling like anything is vital enough to do first but then achieving very little. If in doubt, then, bake a tray or two or brownies. Then jump in cold water. Then just write the list and crack on. Thank you tahini and halva brownies from @ottolenghi SWEET. Thank you @brockwell_lido #seetherainbow #brownies #onethingatatime #coldwaterswimming

I got such a lovely message from the good peeps at  @pimhillfarm the other day saying they were finding my ‘how to make porridge’ rhyme useful in explaining to curious customers all the different types of oats. After ascertaining we were a jumbo oats family, they were ridiculously kind enough to send me a pretty purposefully-sized bag. Bring on the porridge. And the anzacs. And the flapjacks. And more porridge! Sharing the ‘what’s the difference’ section here, for the fellow oat-curious-or-confused crew . . . Full rhyme, as always, in #howtobuttertoast #stockingfillers #christmasbooks #porridge #alsoonaudible

Doubling up on all sorts of FALASTIN (+ the compulsory tahini and halva brownies from SWEET) ahead of a fundraising dinner I’m doing for @amos_trust in two weeks time, along with with @momo_ella and @tomatotamara and @ixta.belfrage and @zaytoun_cic and @jennyzarins and @gemmabelleats and @momokombucha and @passionevino. The evening is about lots of things but, for now, for me, it’s all about logistics! #getitinthefreezer, #batchcookng #cookahead.

One month till Christmas Eve, peeps! Time to start quietly getting things into the freezer for the weeks ahead. . . 

As someone who gets actively nervous without a fully stocked fridge and freezer, being asked by @waitrose to come up with a few ‘one for now, one for the freezer’ recipes for their Waitrose weekend newspaper was the DREAMY commission. I’m near-on obsessed by batch cooking: why not make two of something instead of one and have it stored away for a future ‘ta da!’ meal? 

These are riffs on recipes I’ve cooked for my family for years: often @ottolenghi inspired (unapologetic clone: once you’ve drunk the cool aid, right?!) and often pared right down for ease and kids and all that real-life jazz. 

Your December self will THANK you and your Tupperware . . . 

(Separate thread for another day: the state of fullness of said freezer MIGHT be a source of SLIGHT marital tension when @chriswigley2106 discovers, late at night, that his bottle of gin and chilling Martini glass have been replaced by three kilos of cooked and now frozen lamb). . .

“Joyfully bonkers compendium of culinary wisdom”. . . “Who WOULDN’T want a poetry in a pancake recipe”. . . 

Thank you so much @tonyturnbull_thetimes for including HOW TO BUTTER TOAST in the @thetimes roundup of the BEST cookbooks and food books of the year. Never has a review made me feel so SEEN! 

AND sandwiched between MY two best books of the year @kitchenbee THE SECRET OF COOKING (aka the new bible; aka taking on the baton from @nigellalawson HOW TO EAT as my go-to kitchen confidante and all-things-comfort read) and @finneyclare HUNGRY HEART which slightly broke me down and built me back up again all within the pages of one book. These queens. 

Moved also, of course, to be on the same list as BRUTTO which sits by my bedside and now makes my head spin with the madness and sadness and badness of it all. 

Bring on joyful bonkers, I say. It sometimes feels like it’s all that’s left . . .

Packing for TOAST (with @toast) on tour!

Still pinching myself that HOW TO BUTTER TOAST is included in @tonyturnbull_thetimes round up of the top ten food and drink books of the year. There MIGHT have been one or two ‘nos’ on the journey towards publication for this little puppy and it was my kids who kept saying ‘you just need ONE yes at every turn, mum’. They’re so very right. Know how many ‘nos’ there will always be, for all sorts of reasons. Hold tight and keep the faith and BELIEVE, however (joyfully) bonkers your project might be. Here’s to the yes peeps. . .and to ALL the many ways in which toast can be buttered . . . 

#timesbookoftheyear

Amos Trust’s director Chris reading a poem written by Palestinian poet Hiba Abu Nada, killed in Gaza in October, followed by the lighting of candles and silence before our @cookforpalestine supper club last night. 

#cookforpalestine

It’s easy to feel generally helpless and mute, I find. At the same time, it’s also goosebump-inducing to be reminded about how much love and solidarity there is and how many good people - most people! - just want things to be normal and good. It also makes me spin to see how much can come from just sending out a single email saying ‘Let’s cook! Who wants to come. Or help. Or both’. 

I still feel generally helpless and mute but coming together to SHARE the silence - before breaking bread - felt like something. 

#cookforpalestine 

Thank you so much to the team that made our supper club come to life. To @momo_ella (and @momokombucha for so generously sponsoring the food). Thank you to @ixta.belfrage and @tomatotamara for so much cooking and to @flonickerson for on-the-day CHOPPING. Thank you to @e5bakehouse for the bread and @zaytoun_cic for all your beautiful Palestinian produce and @passionevino for the wine (and to @gemmabelleats for making that happen)! Thank you to @electric_eugene for the stunning menu and wish cards and to @jennyzarins for all the money you raised through selling your stunning FALASTIN prints. Thank you to Chris and Elias at Amos and the Holy Land trust for coming and talking with us all and, continually, for all that you do. Thanks so everyone who showed up to support: couldn’t have done it without each and every one of you.

Just sharing our #cookforpalestine supper club menu, in case of use for anyone who is planning their own supper club and is looking for ideas of dishes which scale up really well and can all be prepped well in advance of the meal: : .

Fatayer sabanekh: spinach pies, p.296 FALASTIN (baked from frozen)
Hummus with aubergine topping, p. 36 FALASTIN. (Vegan) 
Beetroot and sweet potato dip with pistachio bulgur salsa, p.77 FALASTIN 
++
Baby gem lettuce with burnt aubergine yoghurt, smacked cucumber and shatta, p.96 FALASTIN
Pulled lamb shawarma with sumac yoghurt sauce, p. 259 FALASTIN (made a week in advance and frozen) 
Rummaniyya (pomegranate-cooked lentils) p.176 FALASTIN. (Vegan)
Baked rice with walnut, pomegranate seeds and feta salsa, SIMPLE 
Roasted squash with whipped feta and pistachios, p.114 FALASTIN
++
Tahini and halva brownies, SWEET (made a week in advance and frozen)

HOW TO HOST CHRISTMAS. . . What’s your one top tip?!

HOW TO HOST CHRISTMAS. . . 12 sleeps to go until Christmas Eve! Brunsli chocolate cookie making time! These are our to-to Christmas biscuit at home: super chewy and delicious (thank you ground almonds and grated orange zest and Chinese 5 spice), super easy to make and practical (they keep well for 5 days and can be baked from frozen), super giftable and all good things. And gluten free! And they look snowed upon! Recipe in @ottolenghi SIMPLE p.290 and on line . . . 

How to host Christmas: what are your top tips? 

#ediblegifts #glutenfreecookies #homemadechristmas #howtohostchristmas #howtobuttertoast

HOW TO HOST CHRISTMAS. . . Never underestimate the power of a spicy nut! Bake them, jar them, snack on them, gift them. . . This is one to use up all the bags of half-opened nuts you have around but if you want the tried and tested and very winning @ottolenghi recipe for rosemary-spiced nuts then the link is in my bio and stories . . . 

#ediblegifts #howtohostchristmas

The taste (and SMELL!) of Christmas. Parmesan and poppy biscuits make for such a great Christmas canapé. Recipe on p199 of the first @ottolenghi cookbook. Link also in bio and stories. 

210g plain flour, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp paprika, pinch of cayenne, 165g unsalted butter at room temp and same amount of grated Parmesan. Make into a dough, roll into two logs, chill and then brush with egg wash then roll in poppyseeds. Chill again and then slice and bake at 170 fan for 12 mins. The smell, once baked, is ridiculously good. Great as they are or else I like to stick a semi-dried cherry tomato on top with some pesto. 

#christmascanapes #howtohostchristmas

HOW TO HOST CHRISTMAS (a short guide to staying sane). . . . 

Happy Crimbo, peeps. Dotty time of the year, right? Some tips, from me and my HOW TO BUTTER TOAST book, about how to keep all festive feet on the ground. And as the late, great Anthony Bourdain said in 2016, if in doubt “always keep some pigs in blankets in the freezer”. . .
